intro: Elaeocarpus dognyensis, commonly known as the Dogny’s elaeocarp, is a tropical tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange-red in color, containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
